The consequences of the world turning into a single city would be immense. One of the major consequences would be the loss of cultural diversity, as different regions and countries would be homogenized.
Traffic congestion would become a major problem, with millions of people moving around a single city. The infrastructure would have to be upgraded to accommodate this massive influx of people.
Food production would become a challenge, as the single city would require an enormous amount of resources to sustain itself. This could lead to shortages and higher prices for food.
The cost of living would increase significantly, as the demand for resources and services would be much higher than the supply.

The environment would suffer as a result of the increased urbanization, with the single city consuming vast amounts of energy and resources. This could lead to deforestation, pollution, and other environmental problems.
